article.headline: Marshall 65, Tulsa 53
article.story: HUNTINGTON, W.Va. (AP) -- Mark Dorris scored 17 points and grabbed 11 rebounds to lead Marshall to a 65-53 victory over Tulsa on Wednesday night. Markel Humphrey and Travis Aikens added 15 points apiece as Marshall (6-11, 1-3 Conference USA) ended a three-game losing streak and won its first Conference USA game this season. Jamal McLean scored 12 points and Rod Earls and Ben Uzoh each added 10 for Tulsa (12-4, 2-1), which saw its three-game winning streak come to an end. Marshall held a double-digit lead for the majority of the second half, but Tulsa cut the deficit to six with 5:50 left on a basket by Uzoh. However, that was Tulsas only field goal during an eight-minute span and Marshall scored seven straight points to push its lead to 13. Marshall took a double-digit lead early in the second half with an 11-3 run and used solid defense to keep the Golden Hurricane at a distance. Tulsa hit just 29 percent (18-of-61) of its field goals. The Golden Hurricane also had trouble from the foul line, connecting on just 15-of-25 free throws.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
